CommandDoccommentNode.comment:
Unfold definitions commonly used in well founded relation definitions.
Since Lean 4.12, Lean unfolds these definitions automatically before presenting the goal to the user, and this tactic should no longer be necessary. Calls to `simp_wf` can be removed or replaced by plain calls to `simp`. -/

AtomNode.val:
Unfold definitions commonly used in well founded relation definitions.
Since Lean 4.12, Lean unfolds these definitions automatically before presenting the goal to the user, and this tactic should no longer be necessary. Calls to `simp_wf` can be removed or replaced by plain calls to `simp`. -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: This tactic is used internally by lean before presenting the proof obligations from a well-founded definition to the user via `decreasing_by`. It is not necessary to use this tactic manually. -/

AtomNode.val: This tactic is used internally by lean before presenting the proof obligations from a well-founded definition to the user via `decreasing_by`. It is not necessary to use this tactic manually. -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Extensible helper tactic for `decreasing_tactic`. This handles the "base case" reasoning after applying lexicographic order lemmas. It can be extended by adding more macro definitions, e.g. ``` macro_rules | `(tactic| decreasing_trivial) => `(tactic| linarith) ``` -/

AtomNode.val: Extensible helper tactic for `decreasing_tactic`. This handles the "base case" reasoning after applying lexicographic order lemmas. It can be extended by adding more macro definitions, e.g. ``` macro_rules | `(tactic| decreasing_trivial) => `(tactic| linarith) ``` -/

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Variant of `decreasing_trivial` that does not use `omega`, intended to be used in core modules before `omega` is available. -/

AtomNode.val: Variant of `decreasing_trivial` that does not use `omega`, intended to be used in core modules before `omega` is available. -/

AtomNode.trailing: -- a - (i+1) < a - i if i < a

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: Constructs a proof of decreasing along a well founded relation, by simplifying, then applying lexicographic order lemmas and finally using `ts` to solve the base case. If it fails, it prints a message to help the user diagnose an ill-founded recursive definition. -/

AtomNode.val: Constructs a proof of decreasing along a well founded relation, by simplifying, then applying lexicographic order lemmas and finally using `ts` to solve the base case. If it fails, it prints a message to help the user diagnose an ill-founded recursive definition. -/

"failed to prove termination, possible solutions: - Use `have`-expressions to prove the remaining goals - Use `termination_by` to specify a different well-founded relation - Use `decreasing_by` to specify your own tactic for discharging this kind of goal"

CommandDoccommentNode.comment: `decreasing_tactic` is called by default on well-founded recursions in order to synthesize a proof that recursive calls decrease along the selected well founded relation. It can be locally overridden by using `decreasing_by tac` on the recursive definition, and it can also be globally extended by adding more definitions for `decreasing_tactic` (or `decreasing_trivial`, which this tactic calls). -/

AtomNode.val: `decreasing_tactic` is called by default on well-founded recursions in order to synthesize a proof that recursive calls decrease along the selected well founded relation. It can be locally overridden by using `decreasing_by tac` on the recursive definition, and it can also be globally extended by adding more definitions for `decreasing_tactic` (or `decreasing_trivial`, which this tactic calls). -/

Comment.text:
Unfold definitions commonly used in well founded relation definitions.
Since Lean 4.12, Lean unfolds these definitions automatically before presenting the goal to the user, and this tactic should no longer be necessary. Calls to `simp_wf` can be removed or replaced by plain calls to `simp`. -/
This tactic is used internally by lean before presenting the proof obligations from a well-founded definition to the user via `decreasing_by`. It is not necessary to use this tactic manually. -/

Extensible helper tactic for `decreasing_tactic`. This handles the "base case" reasoning after applying lexicographic order lemmas. It can be extended by adding more macro definitions, e.g. ``` macro_rules | `(tactic| decreasing_trivial) => `(tactic| linarith) ``` -/
Variant of `decreasing_trivial` that does not use `omega`, intended to be used in core modules before `omega` is available. -/
-- a - (i+1) < a - i if i < a

Constructs a proof of decreasing along a well founded relation, by simplifying, then applying lexicographic order lemmas and finally using `ts` to solve the base case. If it fails, it prints a message to help the user diagnose an ill-founded recursive definition. -/

`decreasing_tactic` is called by default on well-founded recursions in order to synthesize a proof that recursive calls decrease along the selected well founded relation. It can be locally overridden by using `decreasing_by tac` on the recursive definition, and it can also be globally extended by adding more definitions for `decreasing_tactic` (or `decreasing_trivial`, which this tactic calls). -/
